#summary This page shows how to use the MS XML parser

= Introduction =

This tools parse the XML results from MS experiments and extract the proteins identified to be used in the *JBioWH* framework.

The parser includes the MS XML formats from [http://www.ebi.ac.uk/pride/ Proteomics Identifications Database] and [http://www.thegpm.org/bioml/ BioML].

= Details =

First, open the MS XM parser dialog under the MS Tool menu

http://jbiowh.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/ms_1.png

Click on the button *Open* and select the XML to be parsed.

http://jbiowh.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/ms_2.png

After that, you have to select the XML type on the ComboBox and click on the *Process* button.

http://jbiowh.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/ms_3.png

The table will show you the group of proteins loaded from the XML. 

http://jbiowh.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/ms_4.png

Clicking on the *Show All* button all protein will be loaded in a ListTab offering all options available in the *JBioWH* framework. 

http://jbiowh.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/ms_5.png

One or more proteins can be saved to the *Result* tab. Also, all proteins can be saved using the *Save All* button.


http://jbiowh.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/ms_6.png


http://jbiowh.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/ms_7.png
